title: Marion County man enters guilty pleas in Crab Fest shooting
content:
A Marion County man pleaded guilty in Levy County Friday to second-degree murder and other crime in connection with a 2013 shooting at the Crab Fest event in Williston.
A Marion County man pleaded guilty in Levy County Friday to second-degree murder and other crime in connection with a 2013 shooting at the Crab Fest event in Williston, according to the Eighth Circuit State Attorney's Office.
Devonte T. Ocasio, 22, was sentenced to 20 years in prison on the murder charge. He was also sentenced to 15 years for attempted first-degree murder and 15 years on each of three counts of aggravated battery with a deadly weapon. Finally, he was sentenced to five years for aggravated assault with a deadly weapon.
All of the sentences with run concurrently, State Attorney's Office spokesman Darry Lloyd reported.
The pleas and sentencing came under an agreement with prosecutors.
Crab Fest is an annual street party that draws about 10,000 people from around the state. The main draw is food, with vendors setting up in yards on a street off U.S. 27 east of downtown Williston. Also featured are music and activities for children.
The shootings started about 8 p.m. on April 27, 2013. Ocasio was initially charged with first-degree murder in the death of Barry Barney, of Gainesville, and attempted murder in the shooting of Daryl Rehm.
Ocasio also was charged with aggravated assault on allegations he pointed a gun at Keller Dukes and three counts of aggravated battery in the shootings of Ariana Brown, Kristopher Brumfield and Nikeria Solomon.
